solution_line_template: The truck driver drives for {hours_driven} hours at {speed_mph} miles per hour, so she drives {hours_driven}*{speed_mph}=<<{hours_driven}*{speed_mph}={total_miles}>>{total_miles} miles.
Therefore, she needs {total_miles}/{miles_per_gallon}=<<{total_miles}/{miles_per_gallon}={gallons_needed}>>{gallons_needed} gallons of gas.
Thus, after paying for gas, she will make ${total_pay}-${total_gas_cost}=$<<{total_pay}-{total_gas_cost}={net_earnings}>>{net_earnings}.
